maml:description.maml:para: Uploads documents to a specified knowledge in Dify, with options for chunking, indexing, and waiting for indexing to complete.

The `Add-DifyDocument` cmdlet allows users to upload documents to a specified Knowledge in Dify. It supports various options such as chunking mode, indexing mode, embedding models, and retrieval modes. Users can also wait for the indexing process to complete with a customizable interval and timeout.
Currently, detailed configuration is not implemented.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the document objects to upload. Accepts objects from the pipeline.
Specifies the file paths of the documents to upload. Supports wildcards and multiple paths.
Specifies the knowledge base to which the documents will be uploaded. Only one knowledge base can be specified.
Defines the chunking mode for document processing. Valid values are:
- "automatic" (default): Automatically determines chunking rules.
- "custom": Allows specifying custom chunking rules.
Determines the indexing mode for documents. Valid values are:
- "high_quality" (default): Uses advanced embedding models.
- "economy": Uses a less resource-intensive indexing method.
Specifies the embedding model to use for high-quality indexing. If omitted, the system's default embedding model is used.
Defines the retrieval mode for document search. Valid values are:
- "semantic_search" (default): Uses semantic search.
- "full_text_search": Not yet implemented.
- "hybrid_search": Not yet implemented.
Specifies the interval (in seconds) to wait between indexing status checks when `-Wait` is used.
Specifies the maximum time (in seconds) to wait for indexing completion when `-Wait` is used.
Indicates whether to wait for indexing to complete before returning.
Defines the chunking mode for document processing. Valid values are:
- "automatic" (default): Automatically determines chunking rules.
- "custom": Allows specifying custom chunking rules.
Specifies the embedding model to use for high-quality indexing. If omitted, the system's default embedding model is used.
Determines the indexing mode for documents. Valid values are:
- "high_quality" (default): Uses advanced embedding models.
- "economy": Uses a less resource-intensive indexing method.
Specifies the interval (in seconds) to wait between indexing status checks when `-Wait` is used.
Specifies the document objects to upload. Accepts objects from the pipeline.
Specifies the knowledge base to which the documents will be uploaded. Only one knowledge base can be specified.
Specifies the file paths of the documents to upload. Supports wildcards and multiple paths.
Defines the retrieval mode for document search. Valid values are:
- "semantic_search" (default): Uses semantic search.
- "full_text_search": Not yet implemented.
- "hybrid_search": Not yet implemented.
Specifies the maximum time (in seconds) to wait for indexing completion when `-Wait` is used.
Indicates whether to wait for indexing to complete before returning.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Upload documents by specifying file paths, supports wildcards and multiple paths.
Upload documents by specifing files from Get-Item or Get-ChildItem via pipe.
Upload documents with specifying chunk settings.
Upload documents with specifying embedding model.
Upload documents with specifying indexing mode.
Wait for indexing to complete.
Custom wait settings.

maml:description.maml:para: Upload files to the Dify platform. This is not designed to invoke manually, but rather to be used by other cmdlets.

The `Add-DifyFile` cmdlet uploads one or more files to the Dify platform. You can specify files directly using the `-Path` parameter or pass file objects through the pipeline to the `-Item` parameter. An optional `-Source` parameter can be used to provide additional source information for the uploaded files.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
A collection of file objects to upload. You can pass file objects to this parameter through the pipeline.
One or more file paths to upload. Wildcards are supported.
Specifies additional source information for the uploaded files.
A collection of file objects to upload. You can pass file objects to this parameter through the pipeline.
One or more file paths to upload. Wildcards are supported.
Specifies additional source information for the uploaded files.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Upload files (specify file paths, supports wildcards and multiple paths).
Upload files (specify from Get-Item or Get-ChildItem via pipe).
Upload files (specify source information).

maml:description.maml:para: Authenticate with Dify using password or email-based login, enabling operations with other PSDify cmdlets.

The `Connect-Dify` cmdlet allows you to authenticate with a Dify server using various methods such as password-based login or email-based code authentication. After successful authentication, environment variables required for subsequent operations are set.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the server URL to connect to. If not specified, the default value is `https://cloud.dify.ai`.
This also can be set using the environment variable `$env:PSDIFY_URL`.
Specifies the authentication method to use. Valid values are:
- `Password`: Authenticate using an email and password.
- `Code`: Authenticate using an email and a code sent via email.
- `Token`: Authenticate directly using a console access token.
This also can be set using the environment variable `$env:PSDIFY_AUTH_METHOD`. The default value is `Password`.
Specifies the email address to use for authentication. This is required for both password-based and email-based code authentication methods.
This also can be set using the environment variable `$env:PSDIFY_EMAIL`.
Specifies the access token to use for token-based authentication.
Specifies the one-time code sent to the email address for email-based code authentication.
Specifies the password to use for password-based authentication. This parameter accepts a secure string.
This also can be set using the environment variable `$env:PSDIFY_PASSWORD`.
Forces re-authentication even if valid tokens are already set in the environment variables.
Specifies the authentication method to use. Valid values are:
- `Password`: Authenticate using an email and password.
- `Code`: Authenticate using an email and a code sent via email.
- `Token`: Authenticate directly using a console access token.
This also can be set using the environment variable `$env:PSDIFY_AUTH_METHOD`. The default value is `Password`.
Specifies the one-time code sent to the email address for email-based code authentication.
Specifies the email address to use for authentication. This is required for both password-based and email-based code authentication methods.
This also can be set using the environment variable `$env:PSDIFY_EMAIL`.
Forces re-authentication even if valid tokens are already set in the environment variables.
Specifies the password to use for password-based authentication. This parameter accepts a secure string.
This also can be set using the environment variable `$env:PSDIFY_PASSWORD`.
Specifies the server URL to connect to. If not specified, the default value is `https://cloud.dify.ai`.
This also can be set using the environment variable `$env:PSDIFY_URL`.
Specifies the access token to use for token-based authentication.

maml:alert.maml:para: After a successful authentication, the following environment variables, along with others, are set:
If these variables are already set and valid, re-authentication is not performed unless the `-Force` parameter is specified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Email authentication, mainly for the Dify Cloud Edition. Enter the code manually which will be sent to your email address after execution.
SSO-authenticated accounts can also log in via email authentication using the associated email address.
You can use following environment variables to simplify cmdlet arguments: `$env:PSDIFY_URL = "https://cloud.dify.ai"`, `$env:PSDIFY_AUTH_METHOD = "Code"`, `$env:PSDIFY_EMAIL = "dify@example.com"`.
Password authentication, mainly for the Dify Community Edition. Enter the password manually after execution.

If using a self-signed certificate for HTTPS in the Community Edition, disable certificate verification by `Set-PSDifyConfiguration -IgnoreSSLVerification $true` or set `$env:PSDIFY_DISABLE_SSL_VERIFICATION = "true"` before invoking `Connect-Dify`.

You can use following environment variables to simplify cmdlet arguments: `$env:PSDIFY_URL = "https://dify.example.com"`, `$env:PSDIFY_AUTH_METHOD = "Password"`, `$env:PSDIFY_EMAIL = "dify@example.com`, `$env:PSDIFY_PASSWORD = "AwesomeDify123!"`.
Password authentication with predefined password.

maml:description.maml:para: Log out from Dify and clear all related environment variables.

The `Disconnect-Dify` cmdlet logs out the current user from Dify by invalidating the issued tokens and clears all related environment variables. If the `-Force` parameter is specified, local environment variables are cleared regardless of whether the logout process succeeds.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Forces the removal of local environment variables regardless of the success of the logout process.
Forces the removal of local environment variables regardless of the success of the logout process.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Log out from Dify and invalidate issued tokens.
Force logout and clear all local environment variables, even if the logout process fails.

maml:description.maml:para: Export apps to DSL files. By default, files are saved in the `DSLs` directory.

The `Export-DifyApp` cmdlet allows you to export applications as DSL files. You can specify the directory where the files should be saved and include sensitive information (like secrets) in the export if needed.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the application object(s) to export. This parameter accepts input from the pipeline.
Specifies the directory where the exported DSL files should be saved. If the directory does not exist, it will be created.
Includes sensitive information (like secrets) in the exported DSL files.
Specifies the application object(s) to export. This parameter accepts input from the pipeline.
Includes sensitive information (like secrets) in the exported DSL files.
Specifies the directory where the exported DSL files should be saved. If the directory does not exist, it will be created.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Export apps by specifying directly from Get-DifyApp.
Export apps by using result from Get-DifyApp.
Export apps to a specific directory.
Export apps with sensitive information.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve available plugins from the Dify Marketplace.

The `Find-DifyPlugin` cmdlet retrieves information about available plugins from the Dify Marketplace. You can filter plugins by category, ID, name, or search string. This cmdlet uses the public Dify Marketplace API and does not require a Dify server connection.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the category of the plugin to search for. Valid categories include "model", "tool", "agent", "extension", and "bundle". Use "agent" for agent strategy plugins.
Specifies the ID of the plugin to retrieve.
Specifies the name of the plugin to retrieve. This supports exact matches.
Specifies a search string to filter plugins by name, ID, or description. This supports partial matches.

Indicates that the cmdlet should download the found plugins to the current directory. When specified, the cmdlet returns FileInfo objects for the downloaded plugin packages (.difypkg files) instead of plugin information objects.
Specifies the category of the plugin to search for. Valid categories include "model", "tool", "agent", "extension", and "bundle". Use "agent" for agent strategy plugins.

Indicates that the cmdlet should download the found plugins to the current directory. When specified, the cmdlet returns FileInfo objects for the downloaded plugin packages (.difypkg files) instead of plugin information objects.
Specifies the ID of the plugin to retrieve.
Specifies the name of the plugin to retrieve. This supports exact matches.
Specifies a search string to filter plugins by name, ID, or description. This supports partial matches.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieve all plugins in the specified category. Valid categories include "model", "tool", "agent", "extension", and "bundle".
Retrieve a specific plugin by its ID.
Retrieve a specific plugin by its name.
Search for plugins by keyword in the ID, name, or display name.
Download a specific plugin package (.difypkg file) to the current directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve app information from Dify.
The `Get-DifyApp` cmdlet allows you to retrieve app information from Dify. You can filter the results by specifying an app ID, name, search term, mode, or tags.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
The unique identifier of the app to retrieve.
The name of the app to retrieve (exact match).
A partial name or search term to filter apps.
The mode of the app to retrieve. Valid values are "chat", "workflow", "agent-chat", "channel", and "all".
A list of tags to filter apps by.
The unique identifier of the app to retrieve.
The mode of the app to retrieve. Valid values are "chat", "workflow", "agent-chat", "channel", and "all".
The name of the app to retrieve (exact match).
A partial name or search term to filter apps.
A list of tags to filter apps by.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all apps.
Get apps by ID.
Get apps by name with complete match.
Get apps by name with partial match.
Get apps by mode.
Get apps by tags, multiple tags can be specified.
Combine filters to get apps by name and mode.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve the API key(s) associated with a specific app.
The `Get-DifyAppAPIKey` cmdlet retrieves API key(s) for a specified app in your Dify workspace. You can provide the app object as input, either directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the app object for which the API key(s) will be retrieved. The app object can be passed directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.
Specifies the app object for which the API key(s) will be retrieved. The app object can be passed directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get API key (specify directly from Get-DifyApp).
Get API key (use result from Get-DifyApp).

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve tag information for apps.
The `Get-DifyAppTag` cmdlet retrieves tag information for apps. This is equivalent to `Get-DifyTag -Type "app"`.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the IDs of the app tags to retrieve.
Specifies the names of the app tags to retrieve.
Specifies the IDs of the app tags to retrieve.
Specifies the names of the app tags to retrieve.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieve all app tags.
Retrieve app tags by specifying an ID.
Retrieve app tags by specifying a name.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve the trace settings for a specific Dify app.

The `Get-DifyAppTrace` cmdlet retrieves the trace (tracing) settings for a specified app in your Dify workspace. You can provide the app object as input, either directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.
Specifies the app object for which the trace settings will be retrieved. The app object can be passed directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.
Specifies the app object for which the trace settings will be retrieved. The app object can be passed directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get trace settings for the app returned by Get-DifyApp.
Get trace settings for the app using a variable.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve the trace configuration(s) for a specific Dify app and tracing provider(s).

The `Get-DifyAppTraceConfig` cmdlet retrieves the trace configuration(s) for a specified app in your Dify workspace. You can specify one or more tracing providers. If no provider is specified, all supported providers will be queried. The app object can be provided directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.
Specifies the app object for which the trace configuration(s) will be retrieved. The app object can be passed directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.
Specifies one or more tracing provider names to query. If not specified, all supported providers will be queried.
Specifies the app object for which the trace configuration(s) will be retrieved. The app object can be passed directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.
Specifies one or more tracing provider names to query. If not specified, all supported providers will be queried.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get trace configurations for all supported providers for the app returned by Get-DifyApp.
Get trace configurations for specific providers for the app using a variable.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve document information in knowledge.

The `Get-DifyDocument` cmdlet retrieves document information associated with a specified knowledge. You can filter documents by ID, name, or search keyword. This cmdlet can return all documents for a given knowledge or specific documents based on the provided parameters.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the knowledge from which to retrieve documents. This parameter supports pipeline input.
Specifies the ID of the document to retrieve. If this parameter is provided, only the document with the matching ID will be returned.
Specifies the name of the document to retrieve. Only documents with a name that exactly matches the specified value will be returned.
Specifies a keyword to search for documents. Documents with names that contain the specified keyword will be returned.
Specifies the ID of the document to retrieve. If this parameter is provided, only the document with the matching ID will be returned.
Specifies the knowledge from which to retrieve documents. This parameter supports pipeline input.
Specifies the name of the document to retrieve. Only documents with a name that exactly matches the specified value will be returned.
Specifies a keyword to search for documents. Documents with names that contain the specified keyword will be returned.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all documents, specifying directly from `Get-DifyKnowledge`.
Get all documents using the result from `Get-DifyKnowledge`.
Get documents by ID.
Get documents by name (complete match).
Get documents by name (partial match).

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve document indexing status.

This cmdlet retrieves the indexing status of documents within a specified batch. It can also wait for the indexing process to complete based on the `-Wait` parameter. By default, the cmdlet checks and retrieves the indexing status without waiting.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the document object(s) to retrieve the indexing status for. If provided, the knowledge and batch are inferred from the document metadata.
Specifies the knowledge object for which to retrieve the indexing status. This is required if no documents are provided.
Specifies the batch ID for which to retrieve the indexing status. This is required if no documents are provided.
Specifies the interval, in seconds, at which the cmdlet checks the indexing status when the `-Wait` parameter is used.
Specifies the timeout duration, in seconds, for the wait operation when the `-Wait` parameter is used.
Indicates that the cmdlet should wait for the indexing process to complete before returning.
Specifies the batch ID for which to retrieve the indexing status. This is required if no documents are provided.
Specifies the document object(s) to retrieve the indexing status for. If provided, the knowledge and batch are inferred from the document metadata.
Specifies the interval, in seconds, at which the cmdlet checks the indexing status when the `-Wait` parameter is used.
Specifies the knowledge object for which to retrieve the indexing status. This is required if no documents are provided.
Specifies the timeout duration, in seconds, for the wait operation when the `-Wait` parameter is used.
Indicates that the cmdlet should wait for the indexing process to complete before returning.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get indexing status (specify directly from Add-DifyDocument).
Get indexing status (specify from Add-DifyDocument result).
Get indexing status (specify knowledge and batch ID).
Get indexing status (wait for completion).
Get indexing status (change waiting time).

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve content from a DSL file as a string in UTF-8 format without BOM.

`Get-DifyDSLContent` retrieves the content of a specified DSL file and ensures it is read in UTF-8 format without BOM. This cmdlet is useful for reading files and processing their content as a string.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the path to the DSL file from which the content is to be retrieved.
Specifies the path to the DSL file from which the content is to be retrieved.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieve content from DSL file.
Import an app by modifying the content of the DSL file programmatically and piping it directly to the cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve knowledge information from the Dify workspace.

The `Get-DifyKnowledge` cmdlet retrieves knowledge information from the Dify workspace. You can filter the results by specifying knowledge ID, name, search keyword, or associated tags. If no parameters are provided, all available knowledge information is returned.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the unique identifier of the knowledge to retrieve.
Specifies the name of the knowledge to retrieve. This performs an exact match search.
Specifies a keyword to perform a partial match search on the knowledge name.
Specifies one or more tags to filter knowledge by associated tags.
Specifies the unique identifier of the knowledge to retrieve.
Specifies the name of the knowledge to retrieve. This performs an exact match search.
Specifies a keyword to perform a partial match search on the knowledge name.
Specifies one or more tags to filter knowledge by associated tags.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all knowledge.
Get knowledge by ID.
Get knowledge by name with complete match.
Get knowledge by name with partial match.
Get knowledge by tags, multiple tags can be specified.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve tag information for knowledge.
The `Get-DifyKnowledgeTag` cmdlet retrieves tag information associated with knowledge in the workspace. This is equivalent to executing `Get-DifyTag -Type "knowledge"`.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the IDs of the knowledge tags to retrieve.
Specifies the names of the knowledge tags to retrieve.
Specifies the IDs of the knowledge tags to retrieve.
Specifies the names of the knowledge tags to retrieve.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieve all knowledge tags.
Retrieve knowledge tags by ID.
Retrieve knowledge tags by name.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve workspace member information.
The `Get-DifyMember` cmdlet retrieves information about members in the workspace. You can filter members by their ID, name, or email address.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.

Specify one or more names to filter the members by their name.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve workspace model information.

The `Get-DifyModel` cmdlet retrieves information about models available in the workspace. You can filter the models by provider, type, name, and other criteria. It supports retrieving both predefined and customizable models. The cmdlet provides details about model providers, types, and their current status.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Filter models by provider.
Specify the source type of the model. Valid values are "predefined" and "customizable".
Filter models by their name.
Filter models by their type. Valid values are "llm", "text-embedding", "speech2text", "moderation", "tts", and "rerank".
Filter models to retrieve only those with an "active" status.
Filter models to retrieve only those with a "no-configure" status.
Filter models to retrieve only those with an "active" status.
Specify the source type of the model. Valid values are "predefined" and "customizable".
Filter models by their name.
Filter models to retrieve only those with a "no-configure" status.
Filter models by provider.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all models.
Get models by provider.
Get models by configuration type.
Get models by name.
Get models by model type.
Combine filters to get models.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve plugin information from the current Dify workspace.

The `Get-DifyPlugin` cmdlet retrieves a list of plugins available in the current Dify workspace. You can filter the plugins by category, ID, name, unique identifier, or search term. The cmdlet returns information such as the plugin's category, name, display name, ID, description, version, and unique identifier.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the category of plugins to retrieve.
Valid categories are:
- "model"
- "tool"
- "agent"
- "extension"
- "bundle"

Specifies the names of plugins to retrieve.
Specifies the unique identifiers of plugins to retrieve.
Specifies a search term to filter plugins by their ID, name, or display name. Supports partial matches.

Valid categories are:
- "model"
- "tool"
- "agent"
- "extension"
- "bundle"

Specifies the names of plugins to retrieve.
Specifies a search term to filter plugins by their ID, name, or display name. Supports partial matches.
Specifies the unique identifiers of plugins to retrieve.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieve all plugins.
Retrieve plugins by category.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve the installation status of a plugin task in the Dify workspace.

The `Get-DifyPluginInstallationStatus` cmdlet retrieves the current status of a plugin installation task in a Dify workspace. The status includes information about the task, such as its ID, status, and associated plugins. You can optionally wait for the task to complete by using the `-Wait` parameter.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the task information object to retrieve the status for. Either `-TaskId` or `-TaskInfo` is required.
Specifies the ID of the plugin task to retrieve the status for. Either `-TaskId` or `-TaskInfo` is required.
Specifies the interval, in seconds, between status checks when using the `-Wait` parameter.
Specifies the maximum time, in seconds, to wait for the task to complete when using the `-Wait` parameter.
Indicates that the cmdlet should wait for the task to complete before returning.
Specifies the interval, in seconds, between status checks when using the `-Wait` parameter.
Specifies the ID of the plugin task to retrieve the status for. Either `-TaskId` or `-TaskInfo` is required.
Specifies the task information object to retrieve the status for. Either `-TaskId` or `-TaskInfo` is required.
Specifies the maximum time, in seconds, to wait for the task to complete when using the `-Wait` parameter.
Indicates that the cmdlet should wait for the task to complete before returning.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieve the installation status of a plugin task using task information returned from another cmdlet.
Waits for the plugin task with the specified ID to complete, checking the status every 10 seconds and timing out after 600 seconds.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve the authenticated account's profile information.

The `Get-DifyProfile` cmdlet retrieves the profile information of the currently authenticated account. It fetches details such as the account ID, name, email, interface language, timezone, last login information, and the account creation date.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieve and display the profile information of the currently authenticated account.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve system model information for the workspace.

The `Get-DifySystemModel` cmdlet retrieves information about the system models configured in the workspace. These models are categorized by type, such as "llm" (Large Language Model), "text-embedding", "rerank", "speech2text", and "tts". You can specify one or more types to filter the results or retrieve all available types by default.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the type of system models to retrieve. Valid values are "llm", "text-embedding", "rerank", "speech2text", and "tts". If not specified, all types will be retrieved.
Specifies the type of system models to retrieve. Valid values are "llm", "text-embedding", "rerank", "speech2text", and "tts". If not specified, all types will be retrieved.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get system model.
Get system model by type.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve tag information for either apps or knowledge.
The `Get-DifyTag` cmdlet retrieves tag information from the Dify platform. Tags can be filtered by their type (`app` or `knowledge`), ID, or name.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the IDs of the tags to retrieve. Use this parameter to filter tags by their unique IDs.
Specifies the names of the tags to retrieve. Use this parameter to filter tags by their names.
Specifies the type of tags to retrieve. The valid values are `app` or `knowledge`. This parameter is required to execute the cmdlet.
Specifies the IDs of the tags to retrieve. Use this parameter to filter tags by their unique IDs.
Specifies the names of the tags to retrieve. Use this parameter to filter tags by their names.
Specifies the type of tags to retrieve. The valid values are `app` or `knowledge`. This parameter is required to execute the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get tags by type.
Get tags by ID.
Get tags by name.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve the version information for Dify.
The `Get-DifyVersion` cmdlet retrieves the version information of the Dify server, along with details about plugin support.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the server URL for the Dify instance. If not provided, the `$env:PSDIFY_URL` environment variable will be used.
Specifies the server URL for the Dify instance. If not provided, the `$env:PSDIFY_URL` environment variable will be used.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieve the version information of the Dify server.

maml:description.maml:para: Import apps from local DSL files or inline content.

The `Import-DifyApp` cmdlet allows you to import applications into Dify by specifying DSL file objects, file paths, or inline content. It supports multiple files and wildcards, making it flexible for batch imports. You can also pipe the content directly to the cmdlet for processing.
This cmdlet is particularly useful for batch importing applications or when working with customized DSL content that may be dynamically generated or modified.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the item(s) to be imported. This can include objects retrieved from `Get-Item` or `Get-ChildItem`.
Specifies the file paths of the DSL files to be imported. Supports multiple paths and wildcards.
Indicates that the content of the DSL file will be directly provided via pipeline instead of specifying file paths.
Indicates that the content of the DSL file will be directly provided via pipeline instead of specifying file paths.
Specifies the item(s) to be imported. This can include objects retrieved from `Get-Item` or `Get-ChildItem`.
Specifies the file paths of the DSL files to be imported. Supports multiple paths and wildcards.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Import apps by specifying file paths, with support for wildcards and multiple paths.
Import apps by specifying directly from `Get-Item` or `Get-ChildItem`.
Import apps by using the result from `Get-ChildItem`.
Import an app by specifying the content of the DSL file directly via pipe.
Import an app by modifying the content of the DSL file programmatically and piping it directly to the cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Initialize the Dify instance by creating an admin account (Community Edition only).

The `Initialize-Dify` cmdlet is used to initialize the Dify instance by creating an admin account. This is applicable for the Community Edition of Dify. The cmdlet validates the initial setup password (if required), creates an admin account using the specified email and password, and logs in as the admin after successful initialization.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the server URL of the Dify instance to be initialized. Defaults to <https://cloud.dify.ai> if not specified.
Specifies the email address to be used for creating the admin account.
Specifies the name of the admin user. If not provided, the name will default to the part of the email before the "@" symbol.
Specifies the initial setup password required to initialize the Dify instance. Typically used only for the Community Edition.
Specifies the password to be used for the admin account. If not provided, you will be prompted to enter it manually.
Specifies the email address to be used for creating the admin account.
Specifies the initial setup password required to initialize the Dify instance. Typically used only for the Community Edition.
Specifies the name of the admin user. If not provided, the name will default to the part of the email before the "@" symbol.
Specifies the password to be used for the admin account. If not provided, you will be prompted to enter it manually.
Specifies the server URL of the Dify instance to be initialized. Defaults to <https://cloud.dify.ai> if not specified.

maml:alert.maml:para: - This cmdlet is only applicable for the Community Edition of Dify.
- Ensure that the `Server` parameter points to the correct Dify instance URL.
- You can use environment variables (`$env:PSDIFY_URL`, `$env:PSDIFY_EMAIL`, etc.) to simplify cmdlet arguments.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create an admin account by entering the password manually after execution.
Create an admin account using a predefined password.
Create an admin account using a predefined init password (if `INIT_PASSWORD` is specified for Dify).

maml:description.maml:para: Install plugins from the Dify Marketplace into the current workspace.
The `Install-DifyPlugin` cmdlet installs plugins from the Dify Marketplace into the current workspace. You can specify plugins to install by their ID, unique identifier, or via pipeline input.

If the `-Wait` parameter is specified, the cmdlet waits for the installation task to complete and returns the installed plugins. Otherwise, it returns a task object with installation status information.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the IDs of the plugins to install.
Specifies the interval, in seconds, between status checks when `-Wait` is used.
Specifies the plugin objects to install. This parameter can accept pipeline input.
Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for the installation task when `-Wait` is used.
Specifies the unique identifiers of the plugins to install.
Indicates that the cmdlet waits for the installation task to complete before returning.
Specifies the interval, in seconds, between status checks when `-Wait` is used.

Specifies a local plugin package file (.difypkg) to install. This parameter accepts either a FileInfo object (from Get-Item) or a string path to the plugin package file. This allows you to install plugins that you've previously downloaded using Find-DifyPlugin with the -Download switch.
Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for the installation task when `-Wait` is used.
Indicates that the cmdlet waits for the installation task to complete before returning.
Specifies the interval, in seconds, between status checks when `-Wait` is used.

Specifies a URL to a remote plugin package file (.difypkg) to install. The file will be downloaded to a temporary location and then installed. This allows you to install plugins directly from a web server or file hosting service without having to download them manually first.
Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for the installation task when `-Wait` is used.
Indicates that the cmdlet waits for the installation task to complete before returning.
Specifies the IDs of the plugins to install.
Specifies the interval, in seconds, between status checks when `-Wait` is used.
Specifies the plugin objects to install. This parameter can accept pipeline input.

Specifies a local plugin package file (.difypkg) to install. This parameter accepts either a FileInfo object (from Get-Item) or a string path to the plugin package file. This allows you to install plugins that you've previously downloaded using Find-DifyPlugin with the -Download switch.

Specifies a URL to a remote plugin package file (.difypkg) to install. The file will be downloaded to a temporary location and then installed. This allows you to install plugins directly from a web server or file hosting service without having to download them manually first.
Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for the installation task when `-Wait` is used.
Specifies the unique identifiers of the plugins to install.
Indicates that the cmdlet waits for the installation task to complete before returning.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Install a plugin with the specified ID and wait for the installation to complete.
Install a plugin using its unique identifier, wait for the installation to complete, and specify custom interval and timeout settings.
Search for plugins using `Find-DifyPlugin` and install the resulting plugins.
Install a plugin from a local file. `Find-DifyPlugin` can be used to download plugins with `-Download` switch.
Install a plugin from a remote URL. The file will be downloaded to a temporary location and then installed.

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes REST API methods for Dify.

`Invoke-DifyRestMethod` enables users to interact with the Dify REST API by constructing and sending HTTP requests. It supports GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, and DELETE methods. Users can specify URIs, headers, query parameters, and request bodies, as well as manage authentication via tokens or sessions.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the full URI for the API request.
Specifies the HTTP method to use, such as GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, or DELETE. The default is GET.
Defines the content type of the request. The default is "application/json".
Specifies the body content of the HTTP request. Typically used for POST, PUT, or PATCH methods.
Defines query parameters to append to the URI as a hashtable.
Specifies the bearer token for authentication.
Specifies a web request session to use for the HTTP request.
Specifies the path to a file to be used as input for the request body.
Specifies the body content of the HTTP request. Typically used for POST, PUT, or PATCH methods.
Defines the content type of the request. The default is "application/json".
Specifies the path to a file to be used as input for the request body.
Specifies the HTTP method to use, such as GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, or DELETE. The default is GET.
Defines query parameters to append to the URI as a hashtable.
Specifies a web request session to use for the HTTP request.
Specifies the bearer token for authentication.
Specifies the full URI for the API request.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Invoke REST API (GET).
Invoke REST API (POST).
Invoke REST API using a session.

maml:description.maml:para: Joins URL segments with proper handling of slashes.

The `Join-Url` cmdlet combines multiple URL segments into a single URL path, properly handling the slashes between segments. This cmdlet is primarily used internally by other PSDify cmdlets to construct API endpoint URLs.
The cmdlet removes any leading or trailing slashes from each segment and then joins them with a single slash between each segment.
Specifies an array of URL segments to join. The cmdlet will handle the proper formatting of slashes between segments.
Specifies an array of URL segments to join. The cmdlet will handle the proper formatting of slashes between segments.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns `https://example.com/api/v1/resources`
Returns `https://example.com/api/v1/resources` (removes redundant slashes)

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new API key for a specified app.
The `New-DifyAppAPIKey` cmdlet generates a new API key for the given app. API keys are used to authenticate and authorize app-related operations.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
The app for which the API key should be created. This parameter accepts an app object, typically retrieved using the `Get-DifyApp` cmdlet.
The app for which the API key should be created. This parameter accepts an app object, typically retrieved using the `Get-DifyApp` cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new API key for the app named "...".

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new trace configuration for a specific Dify app and tracing provider.

The `New-DifyAppTraceConfig` cmdlet creates a new trace configuration for a specified app and tracing provider in your Dify workspace. You can optionally enable tracing for the provider after creation. The app object can be provided directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.
Specifies the app object for which the trace configuration will be created. The app object can be passed directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.
Specifies the tracing provider name for which the configuration will be created.
Specifies the configuration settings for the tracing provider as a hashtable.
If specified, enables tracing for the provider after creating the configuration.
Specifies the app object for which the trace configuration will be created. The app object can be passed directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.
Specifies the configuration settings for the tracing provider as a hashtable.
If specified, enables tracing for the provider after creating the configuration.
Specifies the tracing provider name for which the configuration will be created.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new trace configuration for the app using the "phoenix" provider.
Create and enable a new trace configuration for the app using the "phoenix" provider.

maml:description.maml:para: Create new empty knowledge to the workspace.
The `New-DifyKnowledge` cmdlet creates a new knowledge in the workspace.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the name for the new knowledge entity.
Specifies a description for the new knowledge entity.
Specifies a description for the new knowledge entity.
Specifies the name for the new knowledge entity.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a new knowledge entity named "My New Knowledge" to the workspace.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-DifyKnowledge -Name "My New Knowledge" -Description "This is a new knowledge."

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a new knowledge entity named "My New Knowledge" with the description "This is a new knowledge."

maml:description.maml:para: Add (invite) a new member to the workspace.
The `New-DifyMember` cmdlet allows you to invite a new member to the workspace by specifying their email address, role, and preferred language for the invitation.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the email address of the user to be invited.
Specifies the role of the invited member. Valid values are `admin`, `editor`, and `normal`. The default value is `normal`.
Specifies the language of the invitation. The default value is `en-US`.
Specifies the email address of the user to be invited.
Specifies the language of the invitation. The default value is `en-US`.
Specifies the role of the invited member. Valid values are `admin`, `editor`, and `normal`. The default value is `normal`.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Invite a new member with the email `dify@example.com` and assign them the role `normal`. The invitation will be sent in English (`en-US`).

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new model in the workspace, either predefined or customizable, depending on the specified parameters.

The `New-DifyModel` cmdlet allows you to add new models to the workspace. The credentials required depend on the provider and the model. You can choose between predefined models and customizable models. For customizable models, additional details such as model name, type, and credentials must be specified.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the provider (e.g., "openai", "cohere") for the model.
Specifies the source type of the model. Possible values are "predefined" or "customizable".
Specifies the name of the model. This is required for customizable models.
Specifies the type of the model for customizable models. Valid values include "llm", "text-embedding", "speech2text", "moderation", and "tts".
Specifies the credentials required for the model. The credential format depends on the provider and the model configuration.
Specifies the credentials required for the model. The credential format depends on the provider and the model configuration.
Specifies the source type of the model. Possible values are "predefined" or "customizable".
Specifies the name of the model. This is required for customizable models.
Specifies the provider (e.g., "openai", "cohere") for the model.
Specifies the type of the model for customizable models. Valid values include "llm", "text-embedding", "speech2text", "moderation", and "tts".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add predefined models (example for OpenAI).
Add customizable models (example for OpenAI).

maml:description.maml:para: Internal helper function: Creates a temporary file formatted for binary file uploads using multipart/form-data.

The `New-TemporaryFileForBinaryUpload` cmdlet creates a temporary file that contains the specified binary file encoded in multipart/form-data format. This cmdlet is primarily used internally by other PSDify cmdlets such as `Add-DifyFile` and is not typically intended for direct use by users.
The cmdlet returns a hashtable containing the path to the temporary file and the appropriate Content-Type header value.
Specifies the file to be prepared for upload. This parameter accepts a FileInfo object, which can be obtained using the Get-Item cmdlet.

Specifies the form field name to use in the multipart/form-data content. The default value is "file". This parameter allows you to customize the field name according to the API requirements of the endpoint you're uploading to.
Specifies the file to be prepared for upload. This parameter accepts a FileInfo object, which can be obtained using the Get-Item cmdlet.

Specifies the form field name to use in the multipart/form-data content. The default value is "file". This parameter allows you to customize the field name according to the API requirements of the endpoint you're uploading to.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $File = Get-Item -Path "C:\path\to\document.pdf" PS C:\> $UploadData = New-TemporaryFileForBinaryUpload -File $File

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a temporary file containing the specified PDF file encoded in multipart/form-data format. This cmdlet is typically used internally by other PSDify cmdlets.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes specified apps from Dify.
The `Remove-DifyApp` cmdlet deletes one or more apps from Dify. This cmdlet supports pipeline input, allowing you to pass app objects directly from other cmdlets like `Get-DifyApp`.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the app or apps to be deleted. This parameter accepts an array of app objects, which can be obtained using the `Get-DifyApp` cmdlet.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the app or apps to be deleted. This parameter accepts an array of app objects, which can be obtained using the `Get-DifyApp` cmdlet.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Delete an app using the result from `Get-DifyApp`.

maml:description.maml:para: Delete the API key of the app.
The `Remove-DifyAppAPIKey` cmdlet deletes API keys associated with a specific app in Dify. You can provide the API keys directly or pipe them as input.

The API key(s) to be removed. This parameter accepts an array of API key objects or can take input from the pipeline.

The API key(s) to be removed. This parameter accepts an array of API key objects or can take input from the pipeline.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove the trace configuration for a specific Dify app and tracing provider.

The `Remove-DifyAppTraceConfig` cmdlet removes the trace configuration for a specified app and tracing provider in your Dify workspace. If the trace is currently enabled for the provider, it will also be disabled automatically.
Specifies the app object for which the trace configuration will be removed. The app object can be passed directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.
Specifies the tracing provider name for which the configuration will be removed.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes documents from a Dify knowledge base.
The `Remove-DifyDocument` cmdlet removes specified documents from a Dify knowledge. You can specify the documents to be removed directly, or pipe them from other cmdlets like `Get-DifyDocument`.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes knowledge entries from the Dify workspace.

The `Remove-DifyKnowledge` cmdlet deletes specified knowledges from the Dify workspace. It supports pipeline input, allowing you to pipe the result of `Get-DifyKnowledge` directly into this cmdlet for deletion.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove members from the workspace.

The `Remove-DifyMember` cmdlet removes one or more members from the current workspace. You can specify the members to be removed directly or pipe them from the `Get-DifyMember` cmdlet. This cmdlet supports confirmation prompts and the `WhatIf` parameter to preview the changes before applying them.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the members to be removed. Accepts a list of objects which can be retrieved by `Get-DifyMember`. This parameter accepts pipeline input.

Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Remove members, specifying directly from `Get-DifyMember`.
Remove members using the result from `Get-DifyMember`.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes predefined or customizable models from the workspace.
The `Remove-DifyModel` cmdlet allows you to delete models from the workspace. It supports both predefined models (removed by provider) and customizable models (removed by model name and type).
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the models to be removed. This parameter accepts objects that represent models, which can be obtained from the `Get-DifyModel` cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Sends chat messages to the app and displays the response in the console.

The `Send-DifyChatMessage` cmdlet allows users to send chat messages to a Dify app. It requires environment variables `$env:PSDIFY_APP_URL` (URL of the Dify API server) and `$env:PSDIFY_APP_TOKEN` (application token) to function. The cmdlet starts a new conversation if `-NewSession` is specified. It also logs the conversation and response in the `Logs` folder.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the message to be sent to the app.
Specifies additional inputs to be sent with the chat message.
Indicates that a new conversation session should be started.
Specifies additional inputs to be sent with the chat message.
Specifies the message to be sent to the app.
Indicates that a new conversation session should be started.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set environment variables for Dify.
Send chat messages.
Send chat messages and start a new session.

maml:description.maml:para: Enable or disable tracing for a specific Dify app and tracing provider.

The `Set-DifyAppTrace` cmdlet enables or disables tracing for a specified app and tracing provider in your Dify workspace. You must specify either `-Enable` or `-Disable`. When enabling, the provider must also be specified.
Specifies the app object for which tracing will be enabled or disabled. The app object can be passed directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.
Specifies the tracing provider name. Required when enabling tracing.
Disables tracing for the app.
Enables tracing for the specified provider.
Specifies the app object for which tracing will be enabled or disabled. The app object can be passed directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.
Disables tracing for the app.
Enables tracing for the specified provider.
Specifies the tracing provider name. Required when enabling tracing.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Enable tracing for the app using the "langfuse" provider.
Disable tracing for the app.

maml:description.maml:para: Update the trace configuration for a specific Dify app and tracing provider.

The `Set-DifyAppTraceConfig` cmdlet updates the trace configuration for a specified app and tracing provider in your Dify workspace. You can optionally enable tracing for the provider after updating the configuration. The app object can be provided directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.
Specifies the app object for which the trace configuration will be updated. The app object can be passed directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.
Specifies the tracing provider name for which the configuration will be updated.
Specifies the configuration settings for the tracing provider as a hashtable.
If specified, enables tracing for the provider after updating the configuration.
Specifies the app object for which the trace configuration will be updated. The app object can be passed directly or via a pipeline from `Get-DifyApp`.
Specifies the configuration settings for the tracing provider as a hashtable.
If specified, enables tracing for the provider after updating the configuration.
Specifies the tracing provider name for which the configuration will be updated.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Update the trace configuration for the app using the "langfuse" provider.
Update and enable the trace configuration for the app using the "langsmith" provider.

maml:description.maml:para: Writes the provided content to a DSL file at the specified path, ensuring UTF-8 encoding without BOM.

The `Set-DifyDSLContent` cmdlet writes content to a specified DSL file. If the file does not exist, it creates a new file. The content is written in UTF-8 encoding without a byte order mark (BOM). This cmdlet is particularly useful for modifying DSL files programmatically or preparing them for other cmdlets that use DSL files.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
The content to be written to the DSL file. This parameter accepts pipeline input.
The path to the DSL file where the content will be written. If the specified file does not exist, it will be created.
The content to be written to the DSL file. This parameter accepts pipeline input.
The path to the DSL file where the content will be written. If the specified file does not exist, it will be created.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example replaces an old knowledge ID in the `$RawContent` variable with a new knowledge ID and saves the modified content to a new DSL file located at `DSLs/new.yml`.

maml:description.maml:para: Change a member's role in the workspace.
The `Set-DifyMemberRole` cmdlet changes the role of one or more members in the workspace. The available roles are:
- `normal`
- `editor`
- `admin`
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the member or members whose role will be changed. Accepts objects from the pipeline.
Specifies the new role to assign to the members. Valid values are:
- `normal`
- `editor`
- `admin`
Specifies the member or members whose role will be changed. Accepts objects from the pipeline.
Specifies the new role to assign to the members. Valid values are:
- `normal`
- `editor`
- `admin`

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves the member `John Doe` using `Get-DifyMember` and changes their role to `editor`.

maml:description.maml:para: Set the default system model for the workspace.

The `Set-DifySystemModel` cmdlet configures the default system model for the workspace. It can take a model object from the pipeline or specify the type, provider, and name directly. This allows granular control over the system model used for different functionalities like LLM, text embedding, speech-to-text, and more.
The cmdlet validates the input parameters to ensure they conform to the supported model types and providers.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the model object(s) to configure as the default system model. It can be passed directly via the pipeline.
Specifies the type of the model. Valid values are: "llm", "text-embedding", "rerank", "speech2text", "tts". This is required if no model object is provided.
Specifies the provider of the model to set as the default system model. This is required if no model object is provided.
Specifies the name of the model to set as the default system model. This is required if no model object is provided.
Specifies the model object(s) to configure as the default system model. It can be passed directly via the pipeline.
Specifies the name of the model to set as the default system model. This is required if no model object is provided.
Specifies the provider of the model to set as the default system model. This is required if no model object is provided.
Specifies the type of the model. Valid values are: "llm", "text-embedding", "rerank", "speech2text", "tts". This is required if no model object is provided.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set the system model for "llm" using the OpenAI "gpt-4o-mini" model by directly specifying parameters.
Set the system model using the result from `Get-DifySystemModel`.
Set the system model by passing a model object.

maml:description.maml:para: Enable or disable SSL certificate verification for HTTPS connections.

The `Set-PSDifyConfiguration` cmdlet allows you to enable or disable SSL certificate verification for HTTPS connections. This is particularly useful when working with self-signed certificates or development environments where SSL verification may not be required.
This cmdlet updates the `$env:PSDIFY_DISABLE_SSL_VERIFICATION` environment variable based on the value of the `-IgnoreSSLVerification` parameter.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies whether SSL certificate verification should be ignored. If set to `$true`, SSL verification is disabled. If set to `$false`, SSL verification is enabled.
Specifies whether SSL certificate verification should be ignored. If set to `$true`, SSL verification is disabled. If set to `$false`, SSL verification is enabled.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Disable certificate verification.
Enable certificate verification.

maml:description.maml:para: Uninstalls one or more plugins from the current Dify workspace.

The `Uninstall-DifyPlugin` cmdlet is used to uninstall plugins from the current Dify workspace. You can specify plugins to uninstall either by passing them as pipeline objects or directly using the `-Plugin` parameter.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the plugin(s) to uninstall. You can pass the plugin objects directly or pipe them from `Get-DifyPlugin`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the plugin(s) to uninstall. You can pass the plugin objects directly or pipe them from `Get-DifyPlugin`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Uninstalls the plugin named "ExamplePlugin" from the current workspace.

maml:description.maml:para: Waits for the Dify instance to become ready.

The `Wait-Dify` cmdlet waits for the Dify instance to become ready. It polls the specified server at regular intervals until it is ready or the timeout is exceeded. This is useful for scenarios where you need to ensure the Dify instance is operational before proceeding with other operations.
NOTE: This help was primarily created by a generative AI. It may contain partially inaccurate expressions.
Specifies the URL of the Dify server to check. If the `$env:PSDIFY_URL` environment variable is set, this parameter is optional.
Specifies the interval, in seconds, between each poll to check if the Dify instance is ready.
Specifies the maximum time, in seconds, to wait for the Dify instance to become ready. If the timeout is exceeded, the cmdlet throws an error.
Specifies the interval, in seconds, between each poll to check if the Dify instance is ready.
Specifies the URL of the Dify server to check. If the `$env:PSDIFY_URL` environment variable is set, this parameter is optional.
Specifies the maximum time, in seconds, to wait for the Dify instance to become ready. If the timeout is exceeded, the cmdlet throws an error.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Wait for the Dify instance at `<https://dify.example.com>` to be ready.
Wait for the Dify instance at `<https://dify.example.com>` to be ready, specifying an interval of 5 seconds and a maximum timeout of 300 seconds.
